Variables
ut matcher factories

List of head expressions for all matcher functions.

Used by UtExpressionCompositeMatcher

ut documented functions
ut should deploy documented functions

Only overwritten if not already set. Default is 1.

Functions
ut matcher factory
ut matcher factory(
String name,
Function func,
String prototype = "",
String description = "",
List<List> examples 
)

Function used to insert their names into the ut matcher factories list.

Arguments
name
String

string name for the function

ut define custom function

Define a documented function in the Scripting Index

ut is a matcher

This determines (through duck typing) if the given object is likely a matcher.

Returns

1 if maybe matcher is (probably) a matcher, 0 otherwise

Parameters
maybe matcher

any object

ut ensure matcher

Conditionally wraps its argument so that the output is always a matcher. Does nothing if the argument is already a matcher.  Wraps with the <Ut Equal To Matcher> otherwise. Often used in matcher factory functions.

Returns

A matcher (pass-through or simply wrapped)

Parameters
maybe matcher

any object

ut ensure matcher list
ut ensure matcher list(
List<UtMatcher> maybe_matchers 
)

Convert a list of expressions to a list of matchers based on their head expressions.

Arguments
maybe_matchers
List<UtMatcher>

list of expressions

ut global lre

Redefine ut global lre to customize how LRE is computed. Default behavior is to always return missing (LRE unsupported).

ut global lre is used by the Equal To and Close To matchers to report the LRE value based on actual and expected values.

ut unregister matcher factory

Removes a matcher factory name from ut matcher factories.

This should be used when creating your own matcher outside of the Hamcrest package. Unregistering a matcher removes it from consideration in UtExpressionCompositeMatcher.

ut with reporter

Temprorarily sets ut global reporter to the given reporter and resets it back to its original state, even if the expression threw an error.

ut get exception message
Arguments
e

List or string value (from exception_msg global variable set within a Try())

Returns

String representing the different parts of the exception_msg variable.

ut get exception expression

Takes the exception_msg variable as an argument and extracts the expression being executed from the list. If the expression cannot be found, it returns Expr( Unknown Expression ).

ut extract thrown string

Get just the first string portion of the exception_msg. If it is just a string, return that.

ut is comparable

Returns true when two objects are of the same type.  This function considers Integers and Numbers to be of the same type.

ut is numeric missing

Returns true only if the argument has the value . (dot)

This is subtly different than just Is Missing().

ut equal with missing

Compares two values and returns true if they are equal.

Considers both values being missing as equal.

Uses ut is numeric missing to determine missing values

Arguments
a

value to compare

b

value to compare

History
31jul2018/juchil

updated to use ut is numeric missing to allow for comparing any value.

ut get show string

Converts non-string values to character.  If the value is a string, double quotes are concatenated to the beginning and end. This is used for showing values in expected and actual results.

ut object supports message

Checks if the given object allows for receiving a given message.

ut detailed type

Get's the type with extra info where appropriate.

ut host table name str

Give it the windows table and get back a host specific data table name. (i.e. it appends ".jmp" on Mac to a given string)

For a matcher that uses this function, see ut host table name

ut as expr

Converts any value into an expression by wrapping it in Glue().

Great for when you want to use a literal value as the first arg in ut assert that

ut expr literal

Wraps the given literal value in an expression.

ut new object
ut new object(
String class_name,
List args = {}
)

Creates a new object with a self reference.

Arguments
class_name
String

name of the JSL defined class to create

args
List

arguments passed to the constructor of the class

Example
Define Class("Foo",
    self = Empty();
    _init_ = Method({x}, this:x = x);
);
obj = ut new object( "Foo", {5} );
Variables
ut concat test label sep
Functions
ut concat test label

Concatenates values together for <ut test>

ut merge expressions

Merges all expressions in a given list with a single glue expression.

ut move to anonymous namespace

Takes a namespace and moves all args with values to a new anonymous namespace and removes them from the given namespace.

ut difference between lists

Returns items in listB NOT in listA.

Parameters
listA

Potentially smaller list than listB. Probably a subset of listB

listB

List that might have items not in listA.

Returns

Items in listB NOT in listA.

ut get symbol information
Returns

An associative array with information

Author

juchil

History
17may18

(juchil) Add windows and data tables.

ut delete symbols difference

Deletes symbols in after list not in before list

Parameters
before

associative array of symbols/namespaces/classes defined before a test file was run.

after

associative array of symbols/namespaces/classes defined after a test file was run.

Author

juchil

History
17may18

(juchil) Add windows and data tables.

Variables
ut lang

Expression to get the code for the current language (en, de, es, fr, it, ja, ko, zh-CN)

Functions
ut localize
ut localize(
AssociativeArray aa,
String lang 
)

Returns a string from the input associative array based on the current language code

Arguments
aa
AssociativeArray

associative array with mappings from language code to value.

lang
String

language code to get. defaults to current language code.

Example
ut localize(["en" => "Hello", "es" => "Hola"]);
ut include jsl files recursively

Looks for files in a folder recursively and uses the Include() function to run them.

Variables
ut nullptr

Can be used to supress printing anything to the log when returning from a function

ut major jmp version
